Sentencas: Despite the high efficiency and flexibility of fuel cells, which make them an attractive technology for the future energy generation, their economic competitiveness is still penalized by their short lifetime, due to multiple degradation phenomena.
Titulo: A distributed real-time model of degradation in a solid oxide fuel cell, part I: Model characterization

Sentencas: As a matter of fact, electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is reduced because of different degradation mechanisms, which depend on operating conditions, fuel and air contaminants, impurities in materials, and others.
Titulo: A distributed real-time model of degradation in a solid oxide fuel cell, part I: Model characterization

Sentencas: In this work, a real-time, one dimensional (1D) model of a SOFC is used to simulate the effects of voltage degradation in the cell.
Titulo: A distributed real-time model of degradation in a solid oxide fuel cell, part I: Model characterization

Sentencas: Different mechanisms are summarized in a simple empirical expression that relates degradation rate to cell operating parameters (current density, fuel utilization and temperature), on a localized basis.
Titulo: A distributed real-time model of degradation in a solid oxide fuel cell, part I: Model characterization

Sentencas: Profile distributions of different variables during cell degradation are analyzed.
Titulo: A distributed real-time model of degradation in a solid oxide fuel cell, part I: Model characterization

Sentencas: In particular, the effect of degradation on current density, temperature, and total resistance of the cell are investigated.
Titulo: A distributed real-time model of degradation in a solid oxide fuel cell, part I: Model characterization

Sentencas: An analysis of localized degradation effects shows how different parts of the cell degrade at a different time rate, and how the various profiles are redistributed along the cell as consequence of different degradation rates.
Titulo: A distributed real-time model of degradation in a solid oxide fuel cell, part I: Model characterization
